summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York forwarding a draft prosecution memo regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The memo was being refined and passed up the chain of command, ultimately intended for the U.S. Attorney and possibly Main Justice.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is working on a draft prosecution memo regarding Jeffrey Epstein and sharing it with a colleague.

events.title: Draft Prosecution Memo Prepared
events.description: A draft prosecution memo regarding Jeffrey Epstein was prepared for initial review.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Email Forwarding Draft Memo
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emailed a colleague to share a draft prosecution memo, noting it had been passed to their supervisors for review.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A draft prosecution memo targeting Jeffrey Epstein was being actively worked on by SDNY prosecutors as of May 2019.
The memo was intended to 'put some meat on the bones' of topics discussed in interviews and establish particular legal elements.
The draft was being refined and passed up the chain of command, first to immediate supervisors, then to the U.S. Attorney, and possibly to Main Justice (DOJ headquarters).
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative and prosecutorial planning efforts against Epstein well before his July 2019 arrest.
